title: Workshop on Electronic Portfolio (E-Portfolio) Design for Reflective Learning

context.prior_knowledge: Experience with basic e-learning tools, foundational knowledge in teacher education, and understanding of language education methodologies
context.additional_context: A course for pre-/in-service teachers learning to design and manage E-Portfolios integrating reflective learning and formative assessments in smartphone-centric limited environments.

learning_goals: Learners can systematically organize three or more reflective learning artifacts on a Moodle-based E-Portfolio platform.
Learners can create formative assessment portfolios using text/image/media materials in a smartphone environment.
Learners can write reflective journals through peer feedback and produce two or more self-assessment reports.
Learners can develop one or more E-Portfolio evaluation rubrics applicable to language education settings.

constraints.tech_requirements: Limited tech environment (no PC, smartphone only)

difficulty: Hard - Complex requirements with multiple constraints
